required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: An Observational Study of the Ethnic Impact of Patients Undergoing Second (2nd) Line Treatment for Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer Using Pemetrexed
clinical_study.official_title: Non-small Cell Lung Cancer: The Impact of Ethnic Origin on Patients Being Treated Second Line With Pemetrexed - An Observational Study

brief_summary.textblock: This large, non-randomized observational study is being conducted to provide data about the impact of ethnic origin on outcomes and resource utilization during the 2nd line treatment of non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) in a routine medical care setting.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a large 1000 patient single arm observational study being conducted to determine the impact of ethnic origin (Caucasian, African-Americans, Asian-Americans, and Hispanics) on patients being treated for 2nd line advanced NSCLC with pemetrexed given in routine clinical practice. Data will be collected on disease control rate by pemetrexed as defined by Response Rate (RR) (Complete Response (CR) + Partial Response (PR)), Stable Disease (SD) and toxicities. In addition, overall survival, progression-free survival, treatment toxicities, activities of daily living, symptom burden and resource utilization will also be observed. To meet the study goals, a total of 400 Caucasians, 200 African- Americans, 200 Asian-Americans, and 200 Hispanics will be accrued to this study.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With a Best Overall Disease Control Response (Disease Control Rate)
primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline to measured progressive disease (up to 20 cycles [14 months])
primary_outcome.description: Disease Control Rate [DCR] is the percentage of participants with Complete Response (CR), Partial Response (PR), Stable Disease (SD), and SD or Incomplete Response (SI). Response using Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) criteria. CR=disappearance of all target lesions; PR=30% decrease in sum of longest diameter of target lesions; Progressive Disease (PD)=20% increase in sum of longest diameter of target lesions; SD=small changes not meeting above criteria; SI=persistence of 1 or more non-target lesion(s) and/or maintenance of tumor marker level above normal limits.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline to date of death from any cause (up to 20 cycles [14 months])
secondary_outcome.description: Overall survival is the duration (months) from enrollment to death. For patients who are alive, overall survival is censored at the last contact.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline to measured progressive disease or death (up to 20 cycles [14 months])
secondary_outcome.description: Time from start of second line therapy until death, disease progression, or last contact expressed in months. Participants lost to follow-up (that were alive at last contact) were treated as censored using Kaplan-Meier survival analysis method.

secondary_outcome.measure: Functional Status Based on Older Americans Resources and Services Instrumental Activities of Daily Living Scale(OARS-IADL), Ability to Plan and Prepare Meals
secondary_outcome.time_frame: beginning and at end of pemetrexed treatment (up to 20 cycles [14 months])
secondary_outcome.description: The daily activities assessed: ability to plan and prepare meals. OARS-IADL assesses the participant's ability to plan and prepare meals at baseline and end of treatment. Responses: ability to do the activity without help, some help, unable, or not done (missing). The percent of participants responding in the different levels of functional ability are provided.

secondary_outcome.measure: Functional Status Based on the Older Americans Resources and Services Instrumental Activities of Daily Living Scale(OARS-IADL), Ability to Drive or Use Public Transportation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: beginning and at end of pemetrexed treatment (up to 20 cycles [14 months])
secondary_outcome.description: The daily activities assessed: ability to drive or use public transportation. OARS-IADL assesses the participant's ability to drive or use public transportation at baseline and end of treatment. Responses: ability to do the activity without help, some help, unable, or not done (missing). The percent of participants responding in the different levels of functional ability are provided.

secondary_outcome.measure: Functional Status Based on the Older Americans Resources and Services Instrumental Activities of Daily Living Scale(OARS-IADL), Ability to Handle Personal Finances
secondary_outcome.time_frame: beginning and at end of pemetrexed treatment (up to 20 cycles [14 months])
secondary_outcome.description: The daily activities assessed: ability to handle personal finances. OARS-IADL assesses the participant's ability to handle personal finances at baseline and end of treatment. Responses: ability to do the activity without help, some help, unable, or not done (missing). The percent of participants responding in the different levels of functional ability are provided.

secondary_outcome.measure: Functional Status Based on the Older Americans Resources and Services Instrumental Activities of Daily Living Scale(OARS-IADL), Ability to Perform Housework Activities
secondary_outcome.time_frame: beginning and at end of pemetrexed treatment (up to 20 cycles [14 months])
secondary_outcome.description: The daily activities assessed: ability to perform housework activities. OARS-IADL assesses the participant's ability to perform housework activities at baseline and end of treatment. Responses: ability to do the activity without help, some help, unable, or not done (missing). The percent of participants responding in the different levels of functional ability are provided.

secondary_outcome.measure: Functional Status Based on the Older Americans Resources and Services Instrumental Activities of Daily Living Scale(OARS-IADL), Ability to Prepare and Take Medications
secondary_outcome.time_frame: beginning and at end of pemetrexed treatment (up to 20 cycles [14 months])
secondary_outcome.description: The daily activities assessed: ability to prepare and take medications. OARS-IADL assesses the participant's ability to prepare and take medications at baseline and end of treatment. Responses: ability to do the activity without help, some help, unable, or not done (missing). The percent of participants responding in the different levels of functional ability are provided.

secondary_outcome.measure: Functional Status Based on the Older Americans Resources and Services Instrumental Activities of Daily Living Scale(OARS-IADL), Ability to do the Act of Shopping
secondary_outcome.time_frame: beginning and at end of pemetrexed treatment (up to 20 cycles [14 months])
secondary_outcome.description: The daily activities assessed: ability to do the act of shopping. OARS-IADL assesses the participant's ability to do the act of shopping at baseline and end of treatment. Responses: ability to do the activity without help, some help, unable, or not done (missing). The percent of participants responding in the different levels of functional ability are provided.

secondary_outcome.measure: Functional Status Based on the Older Americans Resources and Services Instrumental Activities of Daily Living Scale(OARS-IADL), Ability to Operate the Telephone
secondary_outcome.time_frame: beginning and at end of pemetrexed treatment (up to 20 cycles [14 months])
secondary_outcome.description: The daily activities assessed: ability to operate the telephone. OARS-IADL assesses the participant's ability to operate the telephone at baseline and end of treatment. Responses: ability to do the activity without help, some help, unable, or not done (missing). The percent of participants responding in the different levels of functional ability are provided.

secondary_outcome.measure: Symptom Score Associated With Treatment as Measured by the M.D. Anderson Symptom Inventory - LC(MDASI-LC)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and end of treatment (up to 20 cycles [14 months])
secondary_outcome.description: The symptom score assessed: pain, fatigue, nausea, sleep, distress, shortness of breath, memory, appetite, drowsy, dry mouth, sadness, vomiting, numbness, cough, constipation, general activity, mood, work, relationships with other people, walking, enjoyment. Scores for each item range from 0 to 10, where 0 equaled no symptoms and 10 equaled worst possible symptoms. Assessed at baseline and end of treatment.

arm_group.description: Caucasian patients receiving Alimta for 2nd line NSCLC
African American patients receiving Alimta for 2nd line NSCLC
Asian American patients receiving Alimta for 2nd line NSCLC
Hispanic patients receiving Alimta for 2nd line NSCLC

intervention.description: Treatment pattern and treatment initiation or changes are solely at the discretion of the physician and the patient

study_pop.textblock: Patients receiving pemetrexed for second (2nd) line treatment of non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC): 400 Caucasians, 200 African-Americans, 200 Asian-Americans, and 200 Hispanic patients will be accrued to this study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) (any histologic type)
- Stage IIIB or IV disease
- Should have had 1 line of chemotherapy for Metastatic disease
- Adequate hematologic, hepatic and renal function
- Measurable or evaluable disease
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant or lactating females

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Target goals for recruitment were not met due to slow enrollment.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Disease Stage
measure.description: Stage means how big the tumor is and how far it has spread. Stages range from 0 (not spread) to IV (spread throughout the body). Stage IIIB - the cancer has spread to nearby tissue or spread to far away lymph nodes (locally advanced). Stage IV - the cancer has spread to other organs of the body such as the other lung, brain, or liver (metastatic).

measure.title: Histology of tumor
measure.description: This was an observational study, as such, the investigators followed the label recommendations and any changes to the label which occurred during the study, including but not limited to the tumor type.

measure.title: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) Performance Status (PS)
measure.description: Classifies patients according to their functional impairment. Scores range from 0 (Fully Active) to 5 (Death).

class.title: 3 - Partially Confined to Bed, Limited Self Care

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With a Best Overall Disease Control Response (Disease Control Rate)
outcome.description: Disease Control Rate [DCR] is the percentage of participants with Complete Response (CR), Partial Response (PR), Stable Disease (SD), and SD or Incomplete Response (SI). Response using Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) criteria. CR=disappearance of all target lesions; PR=30% decrease in sum of longest diameter of target lesions; Progressive Disease (PD)=20% increase in sum of longest diameter of target lesions; SD=small changes not meeting above criteria; SI=persistence of 1 or more non-target lesion(s) and/or maintenance of tumor marker level above normal limits.
outcome.time_frame: baseline to measured progressive disease (up to 20 cycles [14 months])
outcome.population: Of the 434 participants enrolled, 50 participants had a response status at the end of pemetrexed treatment indicating "Not done/Missing" and were not included in this analysis.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With a Best Overall Disease Control Response (Disease Control Rate)
measure.description: Disease Control Rate [DCR] is the percentage of participants with Complete Response (CR), Partial Response (PR), Stable Disease (SD), and SD or Incomplete Response (SI). Response using Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) criteria. CR=disappearance of all target lesions; PR=30% decrease in sum of longest diameter of target lesions; Progressive Disease (PD)=20% increase in sum of longest diameter of target lesions; SD=small changes not meeting above criteria; SI=persistence of 1 or more non-target lesion(s) and/or maintenance of tumor marker level above normal limits.
measure.population: Of the 434 participants enrolled, 50 participants had a response status at the end of pemetrexed treatment indicating "Not done/Missing" and were not included in this analysis.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: A pre-specified logistic regression was used to assess non-inferiority of DCR in African American participants compared with Caucasian participants. The DCR for African Americans was to be considered non-inferior to the DCR for Caucasians if the upper bound of the confidence interval (CI) of the odds ratio (OR) for African American versus Caucasian was <1.78 which corresponds to a difference in proportions of approximately 14% assuming the DCR in the reference group to be 50%.

outcome.title: Overall Survival
outcome.description: Overall survival is the duration (months) from enrollment to death. For patients who are alive, overall survival is censored at the last contact.
outcome.time_frame: baseline to date of death from any cause (up to 20 cycles [14 months])
outcome.population: All participants enrolled in the study.

measure.title: Functional Status Based on the Older Americans Resources and Services Instrumental Activities of Daily Living Scale(OARS-IADL), Ability to Perform Housework Activities
measure.description: The daily activities assessed: ability to perform housework activities. OARS-IADL assesses the participant's ability to perform housework activities at baseline and end of treatment. Responses: ability to do the activity without help, some help, unable, or not done (missing). The percent of participants responding in the different levels of functional ability are provided.
measure.population: All participants enrolled in the study.

outcome.title: Functional Status Based on the Older Americans Resources and Services Instrumental Activities of Daily Living Scale(OARS-IADL), Ability to Prepare and Take Medications
outcome.description: The daily activities assessed: ability to prepare and take medications. OARS-IADL assesses the participant's ability to prepare and take medications at baseline and end of treatment. Responses: ability to do the activity without help, some help, unable, or not done (missing). The percent of participants responding in the different levels of functional ability are provided.
outcome.time_frame: beginning and at end of pemetrexed treatment (up to 20 cycles [14 months])
outcome.population: All participants enrolled in the study.

outcome.title: Symptom Score Associated With Treatment as Measured by the M.D. Anderson Symptom Inventory - LC(MDASI-LC)
outcome.description: The symptom score assessed: pain, fatigue, nausea, sleep, distress, shortness of breath, memory, appetite, drowsy, dry mouth, sadness, vomiting, numbness, cough, constipation, general activity, mood, work, relationships with other people, walking, enjoyment. Scores for each item range from 0 to 10, where 0 equaled no symptoms and 10 equaled worst possible symptoms. Assessed at baseline and end of treatment.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and end of treatment (up to 20 cycles [14 months])
outcome.population: The number of participants who had measurements for the subscale at those time points.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: This is an observational study, as such, the investigators followed the label recommendations and any changes to the label which occurred during the study.
